<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Desert Drake](/Monsters.aspx?ID=164)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Distant cousins of blue dragons that lack their relatives’ magical talents and intelligence, these desert-dwelling drakes are nonetheless dangerous ambush predators, preying upon isolated desert travelers and outposts for food and supplies. They retain their true-blooded forebears’ resistance to electricity and affinity for sandy environs. Desert drakes’ scales range in coloration from rust-brown to light tan and ocher shades, mimicking the colors of the dunes they call home.

 Desert drakes are among the lightest and most compact of the drakes, though this shouldn’t be mistaken for frailty. Their swooped-back horns and feather-thin wings are adapted to make burrowing as easy as possible. Indeed, a desert drake’s powerful neck makes wriggling through sand and other loose scree as easy as walking for it.

<title level="2" right="Creature 8">[Desert Drake](/Monsters.aspx?ID=164)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Dragon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=50" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary](/Sources.aspx?ID=2) pg. 135</row>

**Perception** +15; darkvision, scent (imprecise) 30 feet

**Languages**
[Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +17, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +18, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +13, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +15, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +15

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +3

**Con** +5

**Int** -1

**Wis** +3

**Cha** +1
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 27 

**Fort** +17 

**Ref** +15 

**Will** +13 

</row>

**HP** 135

**Immunities**
paralyzed, unconscious

**Resistances**
electricity 16

**Wing Deflection** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** The desert drake is targeted with an attack. **Effect** The desert drake raises its wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the desert drake is flying at the time it is attacked, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 20 feet; burrow 20 feet (sand only), fly 50 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fangs +20,
**Damage** 2d12+8 piercing plus 1d6 electricity

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tail +20 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d10+8 bludgeoning plus Push 5 feet

**Draconic Frenzy** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The desert drake makes two Fangs Strikes and one Tail Strike in any order.

**Sandstorm Breath** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [Electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65)) The desert drake spits a ball of electrically charged sand to a range of 60 feet that explodes into a cloud with a 15-foot-radius burst. Creatures in the area take 9d6 electricity damage (DC 27 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). The cloud remains for 1d4 rounds, granting [concealment](/Rules.aspx?ID=425) to everything within. The desert drake can't use Sandstorm Breath again for 1d6 rounds.

**Speed Surge** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Move](/Traits.aspx?ID=114)) The desert drake moves up to twice its Speed. It can do this three times per day.

**Surprise Attacker**   On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) to the desert drake.

</column>
